channel.title: Cybernetics on meanderingexile
channel.description: Recent content in Cybernetics on meanderingexile

item.title: Apollo and Automation
item.description:
Mindell’s Digital Apollo is a great book, and not just for the space-obsessed. Spaceflight was intertwined with the development of cybernetics, modern control systems, and the digital computer. Re-reading it recently while recovering from a bout of illness, I found certain themes especially resonant: specifically, the role of human beings in semi-automated systems, and the nature of human control.

Spaceflight emerged from two, often dueling, engineering traditions: missile builders, who were used to building entirely automated systems, and aviation, which treated instruments as tools for the pilot, and at the time (the 1950s) was only begrudgingly admitting the role of autopilots as a way of enhancing the pilot’s capabilities.
